definition: to stand a good chance/to have great hopes/to be promising
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
to hope/to admire/variant of 稀[xi1]
full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards

sentences.english: These young footballers show a lot of promise.

definition: imminent/just around the corner (idiom)
worthy of celebration/gratifying/Congratulations!
to have boundless prospects
with great prospects for the future (idiom); well worth doing
to be definitely able (to do sth)
to accomplish much/to have good prospects/to have a promising future
to continue the struggle (idiom); to persist/unremitting efforts
making one happy/gratifying/heartening
brimming with confidence (idiom)
to have qualified successors to carry on one's undertaking
to be at the highest level of enlightenment (Buddhist expression)
uncertain/remote/distant and indistinct/vague
to revitalize/to restore (prestige, prosperity etc)/revival/recovery
extremely rare (idiom)/once in a blue moon
lit. to win a victory on raising the flag (idiom); fig. to start on sth and have immediate success/success in a single move
to advance by leaps and bounds
